user_prompt: What configuration sections exist in moss and how are they loaded?

response:
I will start by listing the files in the repository to identify configuration-related files and the overall structure.

$(view .)
$(text-search "config")
$(text-search "settings")

$(note config sections found: [shadow], [analyze], [aliases], [todo], [agent], [text-search], [daemon], [index], [generators], [validators], [strategies], [learning])
$(note loading paths found: .moss/config.toml, ~/.config/moss/config.toml, MOSS_GRAMMAR_PATH, ~/.config/moss/grammars/)
$(keep 1 2)

The search results from `CHANGELOG.md` and documentation provide a comprehensive list of configuration sections and loading mechanisms:

### Configuration Sections
Based on `CHANGELOG.md` and CLI docu

I will start by exploring the `crates/moss/src` directory to find configuration-related modules and then search for Rust structs that define the configuration sections.

$(view crates/moss/src)
$(text-search "struct .*Config")
$(text-search "impl .*Config")
$(text-search "load_config")
